column5: message
Removing outdated documentation images
removing sky and skydaemon commands out of skynet repo, they are now in their own repos
swapping imports to represent skynet being back in it's original home

Merge remote-tracking branch 'skynet2/master'

Conflicts:
	README.md
	rpc/bsonrpc/bsoncoders.go
add defaults for syslog
support multiple messages in single line
logging defaults to syslog now
adding printf
gofmt
more docs
adding documentation
work in progress.  Logging now defaults to local syslog.  Override to remote syslog by providing SyslogHost in log files

Merge pull request #26 from jbaikge/config-duration

Added config.Duration to parse durations
Added config.Duration to parse durations
client - We should be sending more than an empty struct back as our ClientHandshake
client/conn - fixes with closing
client/conn - If timeout is 0 we should set it to something high so the request doesn't timeout immediately
log - TRACE should be more verbose than DEBUG
service - close connection when handshake fails
rpc / client - Handshake should share the same Encoder/Decoder that is used by RPC client
rpc - we need to export ServerCodec type so that we have access to embedded encoder/decoder

service / rpc - Removing bufio from bson encoder/decoder as we're experiencing lost data, also ensuring server leverages the same io.Reader / io.Writer for encoding/decoding data to the connection so that buffers dont cause data to be lost when we create the ServerCodec
rpc - log message was going to stdout instead of logger
client/conn - Add logging to show when request returns
rpc - adding significantly more verbose trace level logs
rpc - Don't log error on Close() if error is connection closed
rpc - Close connection if we have an error reading the header or body
fixing log message
a few tests, log changes, and bug fixes for client and rpc
retryChan needs to be buffered otherwise we end up in deadlock
service - inability to bind to a port should be a fatal, not a panic
removing call to close, stdlib closes rpc connection on error
additional rpc debug logic
close RPC connection on any error, the connections seem to get out of sync and can't be recovered
wrapping unmarshal with check for nil again
fix error when trying to get ValueOf Zero value for interface
account for the fact that we could be trying to decode nil, because we want to read past the next ResponseBody
more debug code for RPC layer
Requests should be thrown off to a goroutine before handshake takes place, this can prevent the server from accepting requests coming in too quickly
adding more debug statements to RPC logic
client/conn - use select instead of using SetDeadline for timeouts
copy/paste errors in last commit
adding trace level logging to RPC layer
EOF is expected when connection is closed
we should use bson.Binary when sending data, it's interpreted as []byte when receiving data
switching bson.Binary type to 0x00 instead of 0x80
error in last change
convert bson rpc logic to use bson.Binary instead of []byte
adding debug code to RPC layer
additional error handling, and log messaging
skynet.conf should be checked in current directory first
add ability to configure GOMAXPROCS from runtime.gomaxprocs config value
use time.Duration for tracking method completion rather than nanosecond int64
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:skynetservices/skynet2
updating log library, also service now reads config to determine if it should log to stdout and/or a file

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:skynetservices/skynet2
fix log min level comparison
mixed up == with !=, we only want to set the idle timeout if the err is is not nil creating the connection
we dont need to connect to zookeeper for builds, we should be printing fatal log messages and not panicing when known errors occur, stack traces aren't overly valuable here
removing zookeeper from tools, it's no longer needed to compile, and to run the zookeeper service it's easiest to just install it via package manager apt/yum/brew
fix compile errors with sky
removing debug log statements
we shouldn't retry when retry timeout is 0, 0 means do not retry, we need to bail out once the response is received
bug fixes, and slight refactorings to account for connection receiving service name as needed for RPC
wrong channel direction
log - properly handle Fatal and Panic
complete refactor of client logic, still needs some edge case/error handling and additional tests, but there is a fair amount of testing now
adjustments to client to fix some bugs, and provide additional debug/trace logging

Merge pull request #2 from mixmastermike/master

Fixed parentheses
Fixed parentheses
Added link to refactor project
client - adding logic to make client more fault-tolerant
service - added MethodCalled stats callback, stats callbacks should be called concurrently
skydaemon - wait for startup timer before saving state, this will ensure if we are trying to start a bad service we dont flood the state file with instances to be started when it's restarted
error could be nil which cannot be casted
Add support to StatsReporter for MethodCalled and MethodCompleted
basic round robin client support (will be replaced later by full implementation when I have the time)
sky - instance output should also show region
small testcase for criteria
cmd/skydaemon - Make sure we shutdown ServiceManager, so it has the opportunity to shutdown it's connections cleanly
tools - update upstart script
cmd/skydaemon - we shouldn't cleanup daemon uuid on startup
cmd/skydaemon - moving cleanHost logic, we have not bound to an IP yet
cmd/skydaemon - adding logic to cleanup nodes in zookeeper for host that aren't actually running when daemon starts up
cmd/sky - adding help for daemon stop
cmd/sky - mv should be done from build box, when doing remote build/deploy, also removed error checks for mv as it's expected to fail when the binary does not exist yet
cmd/sky - need to move binaries to .old when deploying in case the binary is currently running like the daemon
service - Registered callback should be called on startup if the service was configured to be registered
cmd/sky services should register when started by default
cmd/sky - fixing typo which causes region and instance criteria to be parsed incorrectly
sky admin commands should work with different machines in parallel
instances should be removed from daemon when stopped
updating defaults for client
fix issue with constantly calling zookeeper to get instance list (still demo code anyway)
fixing issue with sky honoring hosts flag, as well as deploy config not using criteria already pulled from flags
changing location of state file to be in /var/lib/skynet
adding debug line so we can see what the environment variable for ZooKeeper is, will help with invalid dial arguments being more descriptive
go command not being found, PATH isn't being recognized this is temporary solution, will debug ssh issue later
Ensure we handle EOF properly from daemon, if we receive EOF daemon has died and we need to shutdown so we aren't orphaned
daemon saves and restores it's state

Fix for BSON decode error with large packets

* Using io.ReadFull instead of r.Read
* Incorporated more error opportunities in the case of mis- read and write
* Removed errors dependency
* Thanks to @zeebo for finding original fix

Merge pull request #206 from jbaikge/corrupted-bson-fix

Fix for corrupted error from large bson packets

Fix for corrupted error from large bson packets

Fixes the following errors present in skynet clients:

* net/rpc/client.go:164: rpc: client protocol error: Document is corrupted
* error: Error calling sr.rpcClient.Call: reading body Document is corrupted
close service pool connections after telling daemon to stop so that we ensure connection is closed, this prevents internal rpc client error as well
sky can now stop daemons, and set log level on daemons
all admin commands should now work via sky, including the addition of a command to change the log level of services on the fly
prefix log messages with level
fixing race condition where service unregisters after it's removed
start of admin logic, pipe exists, shutdown works. Need to implement Register/Unregister/Restart, as well as make sure all commands work and exist for sky itself
fixing bug with services binding to ports, if they find an open port due to conflict their config still maintained old config, and was reported incorrectly to ServiceManager
daemon start logic, along with sky command (no cli yet), a couple of issues need to be solved with daemon yet

client works but is very dumb, it just grabs current list of instances and takes the first one, enough for us to get admin commands working between sky and daemon, we'll double back to fully implement the client after that

client ported back over, very dumb at the moment, grabs new list of instances every time and takes the first one. Compiles but not tested, this is just to start on basics so daemon logic can be implemented then we'll implement the Monitor/Listener/Chooser type logic again
build/deploy logic implemented in CLI as well as can use filters/flags to determine which machines should be deployed to
updates to cli to better support adding multiple filters of a given type, and services with optional versions etc
instance list support

remove TODOs

support for listing regions, and services
start of service discovery and sky command logic returning
config should be passed in as a flag
refactoring to work with service manager changes
removing config logic for daemon as it's going to be implemented differently
removing admin addr logic as we are going to use pipes for communication between daemon and services
stats logic tweaks for daemon
implement support for stats reporter interface to report host stats
we should default to a zk ServiceManager so this cmd works by default
a couple minor tweaks with deploy logic
remote deploying now complete
local build fixes, deploy to local from local and remote now work correctly
creating upstart script for skydaemon
adding TODO's
binaries can now be deployed locally
missed passing the flags to go get, so updates were broken
fixing broken tests

ok, i think all doozer, and client dependencies are now gone, daemon and service now compile cleanly, we can work on solidifying that logic now
removing all references to doozer
removing tutorial service, we'll create a new one when we update the docs

cleaning up logic so we can start getting individual components compiling, we'll pull back in clients, sky, dashboard as they are implemented

Merge pull request #195 from jbaikge/skyfix

Prevent runtime panic with topology

Prevent runtime panic with topology

When a service is deployed to doozer with a different region (like "unknown"
because you forgot to set SKYNET_REGION) then stopped, the instance is just
the zero-value and will cause:

panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

Revert "refactoring ServiceClient to be an interface implemented by serviceClient, so that we can build test doubles"

This reverts commit 97f6ca039e364af1d52b78ff4109f8c3f1c1e6d6.

tweaking loadbalancer so that it leaves the host, region etc based on a scoring algorithm, hard set critical thresholds for average response times, and clients connected per service serve as a short term way of negatively scoring instances based on load so that we move to instances on other hosts, regions etc. In the future when we have support for monitoring CPU/Load/Memory etc these algorithms will be based off those

Merge pull request #159 from bketelsen/dashboard-stats-sep

Make Dashboard work with statistics in a separate doozer path
save the work of unmarshalling the statistics from the doozer event if instance monitor has removed this particular instance
if notify() is called with a InstanceStatsUpdateNotification that was translated to a normal update this will already be populated, no need to go back to doozer

although this did help with the case of inside the current service, it blew away the chances of refetching newer statistics, we probably are smart enough not to call FetchStats on ourself within the service anyway, and just look at Stats, or check for a nil value, if nil we call FetchStats
Stats notifications need to be filtered out in InstanceMonitor so that non participating listeners don't receive bogus update notifications
allow instance monitor to send update notifications for stats changes when instance monitor is configured to monitor statistics changes
dashboard initial load now works by passing a flag when creating the listener that says it would like to include statistics

if we create a copy of ServiceInfo in UpdateDoozerServiceInfo(), we can nil out the pointer to Stats in our local function copy, which will trigger the omitempty flag in our json tag during marshal, this is the only place that updates doozer so the stats should never be put in the service directory of doozer
we need to ensure that we cleanup the stats directory whenever we cleanup the service directory
s.Stats is already a pointer, we don't need to dereference it

let's use a pointer for ServiceStatistics, that way we can check if it already exists. If you have a copy of the current service, Statistics will already be populated, so FetchStatistics should be a no-op

to just 'Logger')
